channel.title: Changing Client Backround & Icon
channel.description:
I Was wondering how do you change the client backround and the icon of your client
Backround-Thing In The Backround When Fully Loaded
Icon- Small Thing in the top left hand corner near the client name
^^Those Are Descriptions Of What I want to change
Please Get Back To Me ASAP Thanks :D

item.title: Changing Client Backround & Icon
item.dc:creator: @DingDongDing DingDongDing
item.description:
@DingDongDing wrote:

Look at Shear bar for Sprites than change the background that you want and the same icon

Read full topic

item.title: Changing Client Backround & Icon
item.dc:creator: @gamerbug gamerbug
item.description:
@gamerbug wrote:

ok look at this example. it will make it clear hopfully

example:
suppose the picture was in a folder called “sprites”. I would type sprites into the byte searcher. then go to your folder, and look at the name of the picture… suppose mine is " background " and the extension is " .png ". I would look for something like " sprites/background.png ". just change the “background.png” to whatever your picture is called! =D but make sure it is in the same folder or you will have to make a new directory!

Read full topic

item.title: Changing Client Backround & Icon
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Bmaw, post:4, topic:291647”][quote author=14-08 link=topic=385406.msg2890142#msg2890142 date=1248850439]

With the search bar.

Bmaw, please explain the point of a ‘help’ section if all people do is tell others to use the search bar. If everyone did this, then moparscape forums would just be a huge search bar, nothing else.

K4rn4age is not breaking any rules and is simply asking for help in a help section…
[/quote]

The Moparscape rules are to use the search bar before using the help section as a last resort. If you cant find anything, then come here. I could find a billion results on how to change client background.[/quote]

Maybe he did.

Read full topic
